required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate Safety and Pharmacokinetics of Minocin (Minocycline) for Injection in Subjects With Renal Insufficiency
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Single-Dose Trial To Determine The Safety And Pharmacokinetics Of Minocin (Minocycline) For Injection In Subjects With Renal Insufficiency

lead_sponsor.agency: Rempex (a wholly owned subsidiary of Melinta Therapeutics, Inc.)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, open-label, single-dose study of the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of Minocin® (minocycline) for injection in subjects with renal insufficiency.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics (PK) data on a single dose of Minocin® (minocycline) for Injection in subjects with renal insufficiency and in subjects receiving hemodialysis therapy. The safety, tolerability, and PK data will support the compound as a potential clinical candidate in Europe and will inform the development of future Phase 2/3 studies.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor decision due to change in strategy

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Intravenous Dose(s) of Minocin (Minocycline) for Injection Assessed by Number of Subjects With Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: Safety and Tolerability: Subjects with mild, moderate, or severe renal insufficiency with any adverse events, any serious adverse events, any study related adverse events, and any adverse events with a fatal outcome.

arm_group.description: Minocin (minocycline) for Injection will be supplied as a sterile lyophilized powder in single-use 10-mL glass vials. Each vial contains 108 mg of minocycline hydrochloride equivalent to 100 mg of minocycline. Each cohort receives a single 200-mg dose of Minocin (minocycline) for Injection except for the hemodialysis therapy/end stage renal disease cohort, which receives two 200-mg doses.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 9 subjects were assigned to one of three groups (Mild, Moderate, or Severe) based on degree of renal impairment. All 9 subjects were enrolled in the study from 29-May-2017 to 17-Dec- 2017, at the Univ Hosp Cologne, Germany.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Following the change of ownership of Minocin IV from The Medicines Company to Melinta Therapeutics, the business decision was made to terminate this study prior to completion as Melinta.

group.title: Severe Renal Insufficiency
group.description: Severe renal insufficiency (eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73m2), not receiving hemodialysis (HD) therapy

group.title: Severe Renal Insufficiency
group.description: Severe renal insufficiency (eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73m2), not receiving HD therapy

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Safety and Tolerability of Intravenous Dose(s) of Minocin (Minocycline) for Injection Assessed by Number of Subjects With Adverse Events
outcome.description: Safety and Tolerability: Subjects with mild, moderate, or severe renal insufficiency with any adverse events, any serious adverse events, any study related adverse events, and any adverse events with a fatal outcome.
outcome.population: All subjects (9) subjects who received at least one dose of study drug were included in the safety population used for safety analyses.

group.title: Severe Renal Insufficiency
group.description: Severe renal insufficiency (eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73m2), not receiving HD therapy

measure.title: Safety and Tolerability of Intravenous Dose(s) of Minocin (Minocycline) for Injection Assessed by Number of Subjects With Adverse Events
measure.description: Safety and Tolerability: Subjects with mild, moderate, or severe renal insufficiency with any adverse events, any serious adverse events, any study related adverse events, and any adverse events with a fatal outcome.
measure.population: All subjects (9) subjects who received at least one dose of study drug were included in the safety population used for safety analyses.

class.title: Number of subjects with any AE
Number of subjects with any SAE
Number of subjects with study related AE
Number subjects with AE leading to fatal outcome

reported_events.time_frame: All Adverse Events (AEs) occurring from the time when first dose was administered up to the last follow-up visit (Day 6) where collected.

group.title: Severe Renal Insufficiency
group.description: Severe renal insufficiency (eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73m2), not receiving HD therapy

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Early Termination of the study lead to a small number of subjects analyzed.
